org.openimaj.ml.clustering.random

Class RandomSetLongClusterer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.ml.clustering.random.RandomLongClusterer
      • org.openimaj.ml.clustering.random.RandomSetLongClusterer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Clusterer<long[][]>, SpatialClusterer<LongCentroidsResult,long[]>

    public class RandomSetLongClusterer
extends RandomLongClusterer
    A similar strategy to RandomSetLongClusterer however it is guaranteed that the same training vector will not be sampled more than once.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk), Sina Samangooei (ss@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.openimaj.ml.clustering.random.RandomLongClusterer

        K, M, random, seed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RandomSetLongClusterer(int M)
      Creates a new random byte cluster used to create K centroids with data containing M elements.
      RandomSetLongClusterer(int M, int K)
      Creates a new random byte cluster used to create centroids with data containing M elements.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomSetLongClusterer

        public RandomSetLongClusterer(int M)
        Creates a new random byte cluster used to create K centroids with data containing M elements.
        Parameters:
        M - number of elements in each data vector

      • RandomSetLongClusterer

        public RandomSetLongClusterer(int M,
                              int K)
        Creates a new random byte cluster used to create centroids with data containing M elements. The number of clusters will be equal to the number of data points provided in training.
        Parameters:
        M - number of elements in each data vector
        K - number of centroids to be created

    • Method Detail

      • cluster

        public LongCentroidsResult cluster(long[][] data)
        Selects K elements from the provided data as the centroids of the clusters. If K is -1 all provided data points will be selected. It is guaranteed that the same data point will not be selected many times, though this is not the case if two seperate entries provided are identical.
        Specified by:
        cluster in interface SpatialClusterer<LongCentroidsResult,long[]>
        Overrides:
        cluster in class RandomLongClusterer
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        Returns:
        the selected centroids

      • cluster

        public LongCentroidsResult cluster(DataSource<long[]> data)
        Selects K elements from the provided DataSource as the centroids of the clusters. If K is -1 all provided data points will be selected. It is guaranteed that the same data point will not be selected many times, though this is not the case if two seperate entries provided are identical.
        Specified by:
        cluster in interface SpatialClusterer<LongCentroidsResult,long[]>
        Overrides:
        cluster in class RandomLongClusterer
        Parameters:
        data - the data.
        Returns:
        the selected centroids
